intro: Pterocephalus multiflorus subsp. obtusifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved pterocephalus, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its stout, branched stems and showy, yellowish to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. This subspecies is noted for its ecological importance in stabilizing soil in desert regions.
